data.title: A classic and historic bar.
data.text:
We relaxed with some single malt whisky in a beautiful historic bar. Originally only open to men, ladies are welcome now!
It was busy but the staff was great. The men's room is actually a destination with a historical marker type plaque. Ladies if it is clear you are allowed to look at the preserved art deco room.

data.title: A Clubby Do Not Miss Bar!
data.text: An old-school leather and wood bar in a very old hotel building.  I am told that many movie scenes have been shot here and in the men's room, with its unique colored facilities complete with a shoe shine stand.  Drinks and appetizers are not cheap, nor would you expect them to be.  They have a huge selection of hard-to-find bourbons and whiskeys.  Unique and wonderful appetizers completed the experience.  Do not miss this place when in Nashville.

data.title: Atmospheric Bar
data.text:
We called into the Oak Bar in the Hermitage Hotel for a late afternoon/early evening drink. The hotel is very stylish and the Oak Bar is comfortable and atmospheric. We enjoyed some drinks from the happy hour menu and my husband had a special treat in trying the Jack Daniel's Single Barrel Whiskey. 

We would have liked to be able to stay longer and eat in the hotel, as it looked very good. 

Service was helpful and efficient.

data.title: Beautiful wood over 100 years old.
data.text: We stopped by the bar several times because of Deb the bartender. She was so friendly you would think she was an old friend. You could tell everyone liked her and she took time with everyone.

data.title: Old time luxury.
data.text: Historic cozy bar with good drinks and food. Quiet, refined atmosphere. The men's room is a must-see!

data.title: Perfect hotel bar
data.text: The Oak Bar is just what a hotel bar should be.  It is not too big, and it feels like private luxury.  Deb is an outstanding bartender.  She is not just competent, she can read customers and be whatever they need.  For us, she was a comedian and kept us laughing throughout our stay at her bar.  Be sure to check out the men's room...it is worth seeing.

data.title: Love this place for a drink!
data.text:
Love this place for a drink!
Try the Jefferson Ocean over a cube of ice. Cool vibe. Great starting point to meet friends before dinner else where. Great servers.

data.title: Casually comfortable
data.text: This bar downstairs in the Hermitage Hotel is fun! Most anything downtown in Nashville is nice, and the Oak Bar is no exception. No reservations taken, but the minute we arrived somebody invited us to take their place as they left the bar. We had burgers. And fabulous fries. And beer, a bourbon, and yummy espresso martinis. Walking distance to TPAC shows. Or just a stroll in this pretty area of town. The parking garage across the street is only $10 at night.

data.title: good night cap
data.text: quiet bar, lovely hotel, free wifi, and reasonably-priced drinks; can't say enough about the great service at this hotel

data.title: Beatific venue
data.text: What a gorgeous room and hotel. We arrived late and needed just a quick bite and this was perfect. Good service and just snuck in for happy hour. Nice wines by the glass and great bourbons. Deviled eggs and fried green tomatoes were excellent. Shrimp appetiZer was just ok. Burger was good but nothing unusual.

data.title: Unusually good food.
data.text:
We stayed at the Hermitage for 3 nights and enjoyed the Oak Bar for lunch twice. Typical bar fare with a twist, it's super good, read, gourmet. 
The truffle fries are a special treat. The deviled eggs were super good and the best was the grilled cheese sandwich. Wow. 
Enjoy.

data.title: Relaxing is Easy
data.text: If you are in a frame of mind for oak walls, leather chairs,  relaxing conversation and a well crafted cocktail or two you need to make your way here.   A nice whisky selection outside of the norm which was a great find and the perfect ambiance.

data.title: Cozy and delicious
data.text: My daughter and I had been traveling all day and were staying at the hotel upstairs so we just wandered into this bar for a quick bite.  She had the hot dog and I had the chicken pate, and we both agreed it was the best hot dog and pate we'd ever had.  The waiter was really friendly...we chatted about the golf tournament on the bar TV for a little bit.  The place was cozy and was a nice reprieve from a day of driving.

data.title: Southern Tour
data.text: This is a cozy bar, and I hear it's a local favorite. Can get noisy, but we liked it. Bartenders were great

data.title: Cozy Retreat
data.text: We loved the Oak Bar. The bartenders are wonderful and gave us great insider tips. They have creative drinks and an intimate atmosphere

data.title: Old Oak Bar
data.text: Not too big but it packs a big punch!  Great little oak paneled lounge with great food and properly created drinks!  Loved this spot for a night cap at the awesome Hermitage Hotel.

data.title: Nice quiet place for dinner after a long day traveling
data.text: I am so happy I walked the extra block to find this place.  After 14 hours of travel to get here, I was just about too tired to eat.  A friend suggested eating here and I am glad I listened.  I had the trout with veggies and a glass of wine.  The food was delish, and the staff was of utmost professionalism.  This would be a great place for a dinner with a client where you wanted to impress but not overwhelm or be showy.  There is also one of the most interesting selections of whiskey I have seen in a while.

data.title: Quite bar for a quick drink or snack
data.text: We stayed at the Hotel and dropped into the bar for a late lunch twice while we were there. Its nothing fancy and it is good for a drink while waiting for dinner reservations, or if you want some quick eats The food menu was sandwiches and snacks with a couple of heartier offerings. If you are looking to get away from the music bar scene on Broadway its an OK choice. If you are looking for the "in" spot this really isn't it. Its a little off the path so most likely you are staying or eating at the hotel when you go here.

data.title: Old Nashville
data.text: Very nice old bar, dark wood, vibey, comfortable, relaxing!  Nice bourbon selection!  Great service in one of the oldest hotels in Nashville.  The history behind this place makes it worth visiting!

data.title: not up to expectation
data.text: Expectation was very high!  Delivery was poor.  The look was of an average bar, while I expected rich (not price but ambiance) furnishings and decor.  Behind the bar were visible plastic glass racks.  Service was friendly but mostly absent.  I expected an extensive wine list but there was just one average Pinot Noir.  The bar menu looked interesting so I ordered  a shrimp and avocado salad which turned out to be mushed avocado and shrimp bits on toast.  The salad part consisted of one small leaf of something.  I asked to delete the watermelon, which they did.  Worst of all it took 30+ minutes to deliver and the bar was quiet.  Sorry, there are much better bars in Nashville.
